result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Helen Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen appeared by video for Nicole Helen Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties. Defense counsel requests adjourned Jury Trial date to allow more time as blood results were recently received. 
State informed the Court that an amended criminal complaint will be filed. 
Court vacates the 11/7/2022 Jury Trial. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Court orders defendant turned over to Justice Point for level 5 supervision. Absolute sobriety to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.

Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen appeared by video for Nicole Helen Nelson.  Attorney M Samir Siddique and Sarah Dahdough in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Bail $750 signature bond. Case remains calendared for final pretrial on 10-17-2022 and jury trial on 11-07-2022, Branch 30.

Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen in court for Nicole Helen Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding bail. Bail/bond hearing scheduled. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicole Helen Nelson appeared by video means.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicole Helen Nelson appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Amanda Kremer as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/2022 and on the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full. Order signed and filed and emailed to defense counsel.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Nicole Helen Nelson in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicole Helen Nelson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case (21CT731) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defense reserves entry of plea.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
